lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* A class that represents the main Duke bot.
* The main method, once run, will start the bot.
* @param args The list of arguments given to the main method.
* A class that encapsulates the main runtime operations of Duke.
* Has two main methods: start and stop.
* Starts the main Duke bot and executes the main runtime operations of Duke.
* A class that handles exceptions for Duke.
* @param errorMessage The error message given to the DukeException object, to be displayed to the user.
* A class that handles the parsing of various inputs given to Duke by the user.
* Returns a Command object according to the input given by the user.
* Parses the user input using string matching.
* @param input The input given by the user.
* @return A Command object that corresponds to the input given.
* @throws DukeException if the input could not be parsed.
public static Command parse(String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("You've entered an unknown request... The main.java.bot doesn't know what that means!");

* @throws DukeException if there is an error loading the local data.
public static TaskList load() throws DukeException {

* A class that encapsulates the list of tasks that the user currently has on Duke.
* Returns an ArrayList of Task objects currently stored in the TaskList.
* Sets the current ArrayList within the TaskList as the one given.
* @param list The list to be set as the new ArrayList within the TaskList object.
* Returns a Task object currently stored in the given index.
* @param index The index of the Task object to be returned.
* @return A Task object at the given index.
* Sets the Task at the index given as the given Task.
* @param index The index of the Task to be set.
* @param task The new Task object to replace the current Task object at the given index.
public void setTask(int index, Task task) {
* Adds the given Task to the end of the TaskList.
* @param task The new Task object to be added to TaskList.
* Removes the Task object at the given index.
* @param index The index of the Task object to be removed.
* Returns an integer corresponding to the size of the TaskList, i.e. the number of tasks in the TaskList.
* A class that encapsulates all UI components of Duke.
private static DateTimeFormatter inputFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/MM/yyyy kkmm");
private static DateTimeFormatter outputFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy - hh:mm a");

* @return A String corresponding to the latest user input.

+ "What can I do for you today?\n"
* Shows the exit message to the user.
System.out.println("-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~-~\n" + "Bye... Hope to see you again soon!\n"

* A class that encapsulates a general Command given to Duke.
* @param input The input given by the user.
* Executes the command with the given input.
* @param list The list of tasks to be modified by the command.
* @param ui The UI of Duke to be invoked by the command.
* @throws DukeException if the input given is not of the correct format.
public abstract void execute(TaskList list, UserInterface ui) throws DukeException;
* A class that encapsulates a Deadline Command given to Duke.
* @param input The input given by the user.
* Executes the deadline command with the given input.
* @param list The list of tasks to be modified by the command.
* @param ui The UI of Duke to be invoked by the command.
* @throws DukeException if the input given is not of the correct format.
public void execute(TaskList list, UserInterface ui) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty. Please try again!");
throw new DukeException("The date of a deadline cannot be empty. Please try again!");
"Your time format is wrong. Please enter the time in the format DD/MM/YYYY HHMM and try again!");

* @throws DukeException if the input given is not of the correct format.
public void execute(TaskList list, UserInterface ui) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("It looks like you did not enter a valid integer for the \"delete\" main.java.command. Please try again!");
